58  /*
59   * This test class captures functionality required to achieve unconditional
60   * compliance with the HTTP/1.1 spec, i.e. all the SHOULD, SHOULD NOT,
61   * RECOMMENDED, and NOT RECOMMENDED behaviors.
62   */
63  public class TestProtocolRecommendations extends AbstractProtocolTest {
64  
65      private Date tenSecondsFromNow;
66      private Date now;
67      private Date tenSecondsAgo;
68      private Date twoMinutesAgo;
69  
70      @Override
71      @Before
72      public void setUp() {
73          super.setUp();
74          now = new Date();
75          tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
76          twoMinutesAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 2 * 60 * 1000L);
77          tenSecondsFromNow = new Date(now.getTime() + 10 * 1000L);
78      }
79  
80      /* "identity: The default (identity) encoding; the use of no
81       * transformation whatsoever. This content-coding is used only in the
82       * Accept-Encoding header, and SHOULD NOT be used in the
83       * Content-Encoding header."
84       *
85       * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.5
86       */
87      @Test
88      public void testIdentityCodingIsNotUsedInContentEncodingHeader()
89          throws Exception {
90          originResponse.setHeader("Content-Encoding", "identity");
91          backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(originResponse);
92          replayMocks();
93          HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, request);
94          verifyMocks();
95          boolean foundIdentity = false;
96          for(Header h : result.getHeaders("Content-Encoding")) {
97              for(HeaderElement elt : h.getElements()) {
98                  if ("identity".equalsIgnoreCase(elt.getName())) {
99                      foundIdentity = true;
100                 }
101             }
102         }
103         assertFalse(foundIdentity);
104     }
105 
106     /*
107      * "304 Not Modified. ... If the conditional GET used a strong cache
108      * validator (see section 13.3.3), the response SHOULD NOT include
109      * other entity-headers."
110      *
111      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec10.html#sec10.3.5
112      */
113     private void cacheGenerated304ForValidatorShouldNotContainEntityHeader(
114             String headerName, String headerValue, String validatorHeader,
115             String validator, String conditionalHeader) throws Exception,
116             IOException {
117         HttpRequest req1 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
118         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
119         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=3600");
120         resp1.setHeader(validatorHeader, validator);
121         resp1.setHeader(headerName, headerValue);
122 
123         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
124 
125         HttpRequest req2 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
126         req2.setHeader(conditionalHeader, validator);
127 
128         replayMocks();
129         impl.execute(host, req1);
130         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req2);
131         verifyMocks();
132 
133         if (HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED == result.getStatusLine().getStatusCode()) {
134             assertNull(result.getFirstHeader(headerName));
135         }
136     }
137 
138     private void cacheGenerated304ForStrongETagValidatorShouldNotContainEntityHeader(
139             String headerName, String headerValue) throws Exception,
140             IOException {
141         cacheGenerated304ForValidatorShouldNotContainEntityHeader(headerName,
142                 headerValue, "ETag", "\"etag\"", "If-None-Match");
143     }
144 
145     private void cacheGenerated304ForStrongDateValidatorShouldNotContainEntityHeader(
146             String headerName, String headerValue) throws Exception,
147             IOException {
148         cacheGenerated304ForValidatorShouldNotContainEntityHeader(headerName,
149                 headerValue, "Last-Modified", formatDate(twoMinutesAgo),
150                 "If-Modified-Since");
151     }

223     private void cacheGenerated304ForStrongValidatorShouldNotContainContentRange(
224             String validatorHeader, String validator, String conditionalHeader)
225             throws Exception, IOException, ClientProtocolException {
226         HttpRequest req1 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
227         req1.setHeader("Range","bytes=0-127");
228         HttpResponse resp1 = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, HttpStatus.SC_PARTIAL_CONTENT, "Partial Content");
229         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=3600");
230         resp1.setHeader(validatorHeader, validator);
231         resp1.setHeader("Content-Range", "bytes 0-127/256");
232 
233         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
234 
235         HttpRequest req2 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
236         req2.setHeader("If-Range", validator);
237         req2.setHeader("Range","bytes=0-127");
238         req2.setHeader(conditionalHeader, validator);
239 
240         HttpResponse resp2 = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED, "Not Modified");
241         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
242         resp2.setHeader(validatorHeader, validator);
243 
244         // cache module does not currently deal with byte ranges, but we want
245         // this test to work even if it does some day
246         Capture<HttpRequest> cap = new Capture<HttpRequest>();
247         expect(mockBackend.execute(same(host), capture(cap), (HttpContext)isNull()))
248             .andReturn(resp2).times(0,1);
249 
250         replayMocks();
251         impl.execute(host, req1);
252         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req2);
253         verifyMocks();
254 
255         if (!cap.hasCaptured()
256             && HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED == result.getStatusLine().getStatusCode()) {
257             // cache generated a 304
258             assertNull(result.getFirstHeader("Content-Range"));
259         }
260     }
261

267     }

304     private void shouldStripEntityHeaderFromOrigin304ResponseToStrongValidation(
305             String entityHeader, String entityHeaderValue) throws Exception,
306             IOException {
307         HttpRequest req = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
308         req.setHeader("If-None-Match", "\"etag\"");
309 
310         HttpResponse resp = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED, "Not Modified");
311         resp.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
312         resp.setHeader("Etag", "\"etag\"");
313         resp.setHeader(entityHeader, entityHeaderValue);
314 
315         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp);
316 
317         replayMocks();
318         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req);
319         verifyMocks();
320 
321         assertNull(result.getFirstHeader(entityHeader));
322     }

372

374         resp.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));

394     /*
395      * "For this reason, a cache SHOULD NOT return a stale response if the
396      * client explicitly requests a first-hand or fresh one, unless it is
397      * impossible to comply for technical or policy reasons."
398      */
399     private HttpRequest requestToPopulateStaleCacheEntry() throws Exception {
400         HttpRequest req1 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
401         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
402         Date now = new Date();
403         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
404         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
405         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","public,max-age=5");
406         resp1.setHeader("Etag","\"etag\"");
407 
408         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
409         return req1;
410     }
411 
412     private void testDoesNotReturnStaleResponseOnError(HttpRequest req2)
413             throws Exception, IOException {
414         HttpRequest req1 = requestToPopulateStaleCacheEntry();
415 
416         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andThrow(new IOException());
417 
418         replayMocks();
419         impl.execute(host, req1);
420         HttpResponse result = null;
421         try {
422             result = impl.execute(host, req2);
423         } catch (IOException acceptable) {
424         }
425         verifyMocks();
426 
427         if (result != null) {
428             assertFalse(result.getStatusLine().getStatusCode() == HttpStatus.SC_OK);
429         }
430     }
431 
432     @Test
433     public void testDoesNotReturnStaleResponseIfClientExplicitlyRequestsFirstHandOneWithCacheControl()
434             throws Exception {
435         HttpRequest req = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
436         req.setHeader("Cache-Control","no-cache");
437         testDoesNotReturnStaleResponseOnError(req);
438     }

442             throws Exception {

444         req.setHeader("Pragma","no-cache");
445         testDoesNotReturnStaleResponseOnError(req);
446     }

470 
471         testDoesNotReturnStaleResponseOnError(req);

479

483     @Test
484     public void testMayReturnStaleResponseIfClientExplicitlySpecifiesAcceptableMaxStale()
485             throws Exception {
486         HttpRequest req1 = requestToPopulateStaleCacheEntry();
487         HttpRequest req2 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
488         req2.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-stale=20");
489 
490         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andThrow(new IOException()).times(0,1);
491 
492         replayMocks();
493         impl.execute(host, req1);
494         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req2);
495         verifyMocks();
496 
497         assertEquals(HttpStatus.SC_OK, result.getStatusLine().getStatusCode());
498         assertNotNull(result.getFirstHeader("Warning"));
499     }
500 
501     /*
502      * "A correct cache MUST respond to a request with the most up-to-date
503      * response held by the cache that is appropriate to the request
504      * (see sections 13.2.5, 13.2.6, and 13.12) which meets one of the
505      * following conditions:
506      *
507      * 1. It has been checked for equivalence with what the origin server
508      * would have returned by revalidating the response with the
509      * origin server (section 13.3);
510      *
511      * 2. It is "fresh enough" (see section 13.2). In the default case,
512      * this means it meets the least restrictive freshness requirement
513      * of the client, origin server, and cache (see section 14.9); if
514      * the origin server so specifies, it is the freshness requirement
515      * of the origin server alone.
516      *
517      * If a stored response is not "fresh enough" by the most
518      * restrictive freshness requirement of both the client and the
519      * origin server, in carefully considered circumstances the cache
520      * MAY still return the response with the appropriate Warning
521      * header (see section 13.1.5 and 14.46), unless such a response
522      * is prohibited (e.g., by a "no-store" cache-directive, or by a
523      * "no-cache" cache-request-directive; see section 14.9).
524      *
525      * 3. It is an appropriate 304 (Not Modified), 305 (Proxy Redirect),
526      * or error (4xx or 5xx) response message.
527      *
528      * If the cache can not communicate with the origin server, then a
529      * correct cache SHOULD respond as above if the response can be
530      * correctly served from the cache..."
531      *
532      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.1.1
533      */
534     @Test
535     public void testReturnsCachedResponsesAppropriatelyWhenNoOriginCommunication()
536         throws Exception {
537         HttpRequest req1 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
538         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
539         Date now = new Date();
540         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
541         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control", "public, max-age=5");
542         resp1.setHeader("ETag","\"etag\"");
543         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
544 
545         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
546 
547         HttpRequest req2 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
548 
549         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andThrow(new IOException()).anyTimes();
550 
551         replayMocks();
552         impl.execute(host, req1);
553         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req2);
554         verifyMocks();
555 
556         assertEquals(HttpStatus.SC_OK, result.getStatusLine().getStatusCode());
557         boolean warning111Found = false;
558         for(Header h : result.getHeaders("Warning")) {
559             for(WarningValue wv : WarningValue.getWarningValues(h)) {
560                 if (wv.getWarnCode() == 111) {
561                     warning111Found = true;
562                     break;
563                 }
564             }
565         }
566         assertTrue(warning111Found);
567     }
568 
569     /*
570      * "If a cache receives a response (either an entire response, or a
571      * 304 (Not Modified) response) that it would normally forward to the
572      * requesting client, and the received response is no longer fresh,
573      * the cache SHOULD forward it to the requesting client without adding
574      * a new Warning (but without removing any existing Warning headers).
575      * A cache SHOULD NOT attempt to revalidate a response simply because
576      * that response became stale in transit; this might lead to an
577      * infinite loop."
578      *
579      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.1.1
580      */
581     @Test
582     public void testDoesNotAddNewWarningHeaderIfResponseArrivesStale()
583         throws Exception {
584         Date now = new Date();
585         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
586         originResponse.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
587         originResponse.setHeader("Cache-Control","public, max-age=5");
588         originResponse.setHeader("ETag","\"etag\"");
589 
590         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(originResponse);
591 
592         replayMocks();
593         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, request);
594         verifyMocks();
595 
596         assertNull(result.getFirstHeader("Warning"));
597     }
598 
599     @Test
600     public void testForwardsExistingWarningHeadersOnResponseThatArrivesStale()
601         throws Exception {
602         Date now = new Date();
603         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
604         originResponse.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
605         originResponse.setHeader("Cache-Control","public, max-age=5");
606         originResponse.setHeader("ETag","\"etag\"");
607         originResponse.addHeader("Age","10");
608         final String warning = "110 fred \"Response is stale\"";
609         originResponse.addHeader("Warning",warning);
610 
611         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(originResponse);
612 
613         replayMocks();
614         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, request);
615         verifyMocks();
616 
617         assertEquals(warning, result.getFirstHeader("Warning").getValue());
618     }
619 
620     /*
621      * "A transparent proxy SHOULD NOT modify an end-to-end header unless
622      * the definition of that header requires or specifically allows that."
623      *
624      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.5.2
625      */
626     private void testDoesNotModifyHeaderOnResponses(final String headerName)
627             throws Exception {
628         final String headerValue = HttpTestUtils
629             .getCanonicalHeaderValue(originResponse, headerName);
630         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(originResponse);
631         replayMocks();
632         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, request);
633         verifyMocks();
634         assertEquals(headerValue,
635             result.getFirstHeader(headerName).getValue());
636     }
637 
638     private void testDoesNotModifyHeaderOnRequests(final String headerName)
639             throws Exception {
640         final String headerValue = HttpTestUtils.getCanonicalHeaderValue(request, headerName);
641         Capture<HttpRequest> cap = new Capture<HttpRequest>();
642         EasyMock.expect(mockBackend.execute(EasyMock.isA(HttpHost.class),
643                 EasyMock.capture(cap), (HttpContext)EasyMock.isNull()))
644                 .andReturn(originResponse);
645         replayMocks();
646         impl.execute(host, request);
647         verifyMocks();
648         assertEquals(headerValue,
649                 HttpTestUtils.getCanonicalHeaderValue(cap.getValue(),
650                         headerName));
651     }
652 
653     @Test
654     public void testDoesNotModifyAcceptRangesOnResponses()
655     throws Exception {
656         final String headerName = "Accept-Ranges";
657         originResponse.setHeader(headerName,"bytes");
658         testDoesNotModifyHeaderOnResponses(headerName);
659     }

897 
898     /*
899      * "[HTTP/1.1 clients], If only a Last-Modified value has been provided
900      * by the origin server, SHOULD use that value in non-subrange cache-
901      * conditional requests (using If-Modified-Since)."
902      *
903      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.3.4
904      */
905     @Test
906     public void testUsesLastModifiedDateForCacheConditionalRequests()
907             throws Exception {
908         Date now = new Date();
909         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
910         Date twentySecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 20 * 1000L);
911         final String lmDate = formatDate(twentySecondsAgo);
912 
913         HttpRequest req1 =
914             new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
915         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
916         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
917         resp1.setHeader("Last-Modified", lmDate);
918         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=5");
919 
920         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
921 
922         Capture<HttpRequest> cap = new Capture<HttpRequest>();
923         HttpRequest req2 =
924             new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
925         HttpResponse resp2 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
926 
927         EasyMock.expect(mockBackend.execute(EasyMock.same(host),
928                 EasyMock.capture(cap), (HttpContext)EasyMock.isNull()))
929             .andReturn(resp2);
930 
931         replayMocks();
932         impl.execute(host, req1);
933         impl.execute(host, req2);
934         verifyMocks();
935 
936         HttpRequest captured = cap.getValue();
937         Header ifModifiedSince =
938             captured.getFirstHeader("If-Modified-Since");
939         assertEquals(lmDate, ifModifiedSince.getValue());
940     }
941 
942     /*
943      * "[HTTP/1.1 clients], if both an entity tag and a Last-Modified value
944      * have been provided by the origin server, SHOULD use both validators
945      * in cache-conditional requests. This allows both HTTP/1.0 and
946      * HTTP/1.1 caches to respond appropriately."
947      *
948      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.3.4
949      */
950     @Test
951     public void testUsesBothLastModifiedAndETagForConditionalRequestsIfAvailable()
952             throws Exception {
953         Date now = new Date();
954         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
955         Date twentySecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 20 * 1000L);
956         final String lmDate = formatDate(twentySecondsAgo);
957         final String etag = "\"etag\"";
958 
959         HttpRequest req1 =
960             new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
961         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
962         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
963         resp1.setHeader("Last-Modified", lmDate);
964         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=5");
965         resp1.setHeader("ETag", etag);
966 
967         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
968 
969         Capture<HttpRequest> cap = new Capture<HttpRequest>();
970         HttpRequest req2 =
971             new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
972         HttpResponse resp2 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
973 
974         EasyMock.expect(mockBackend.execute(EasyMock.same(host),
975                 EasyMock.capture(cap), (HttpContext)EasyMock.isNull()))
976             .andReturn(resp2);
977 
978         replayMocks();
979         impl.execute(host, req1);
980         impl.execute(host, req2);
981         verifyMocks();
982 
983         HttpRequest captured = cap.getValue();
984         Header ifModifiedSince =
985             captured.getFirstHeader("If-Modified-Since");
986         assertEquals(lmDate, ifModifiedSince.getValue());
987         Header ifNoneMatch =
988             captured.getFirstHeader("If-None-Match");
989         assertEquals(etag, ifNoneMatch.getValue());
990     }
991 
992     /*
993      * "If an origin server wishes to force a semantically transparent cache
994      * to validate every request, it MAY assign an explicit expiration time
995      * in the past. This means that the response is always stale, and so the
996      * cache SHOULD validate it before using it for subsequent requests."
997      *
998      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.2.1
999      */
1000     @Test
1001     public void testRevalidatesCachedResponseWithExpirationInThePast()
1002             throws Exception {
1003         Date now = new Date();
1004         Date oneSecondAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 1 * 1000L);
1005         Date oneSecondFromNow = new Date(now.getTime() + 1 * 1000L);
1006         Date twoSecondsFromNow = new Date(now.getTime() + 2 * 1000L);
1007         HttpRequest req1 =
1008             new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1009         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1010         resp1.setHeader("ETag","\"etag\"");
1011         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
1012         resp1.setHeader("Expires",formatDate(oneSecondAgo));
1013         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control", "public");
1014 
1015         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1016 
1017         HttpRequest req2 =
1018             new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1019         HttpRequest revalidate =
1020             new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/",HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1021         revalidate.setHeader("If-None-Match","\"etag\"");
1022 
1023         HttpResponse resp2 = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1,
1024                 HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED, "Not Modified");
1025         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(twoSecondsFromNow));
1026         resp2.setHeader("Expires", formatDate(oneSecondFromNow));
1027         resp2.setHeader("ETag","\"etag\"");
1028 
1029         expect(mockBackend.execute(isA(HttpHost.class),
1030                 eqRequest(revalidate), (HttpContext)isNull()))
1031             .andReturn(resp2);
1032 
1033         replayMocks();
1034         impl.execute(host, req1);
1035         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req2);
1036         verifyMocks();
1037 
1038         assertEquals(HttpStatus.SC_OK,
1039                 result.getStatusLine().getStatusCode());
1040     }
1041 
1042     /* "When a client tries to revalidate a cache entry, and the response
1043      * it receives contains a Date header that appears to be older than the
1044      * one for the existing entry, then the client SHOULD repeat the
1045      * request unconditionally, and include
1046      *     Cache-Control: max-age=0
1047      * to force any intermediate caches to validate their copies directly
1048      * with the origin server, or
1049      *     Cache-Control: no-cache
1050      * to force any intermediate caches to obtain a new copy from the
1051      * origin server."
1052      *
1053      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.2.6
1054      */
1055     @Test
1056     public void testRetriesValidationThatResultsInAnOlderDated304Response()
1057         throws Exception {
1058         Date now = new Date();
1059         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
1060         Date elevenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 11 * 1000L);
1061         HttpRequest req1 =
1062             new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1063         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1064         resp1.setHeader("ETag","\"etag\"");
1065         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
1066         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=5");
1067 
1068         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1069 
1070         HttpRequest req2 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1071         HttpResponse resp2 = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1,
1072                 HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED, "Not Modified");
1073         resp2.setHeader("ETag","\"etag\"");
1074         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(elevenSecondsAgo));
1075 
1076         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1077 
1078         Capture<HttpRequest> cap = new Capture<HttpRequest>();
1079         HttpResponse resp3 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1080         resp3.setHeader("ETag","\"etag2\"");
1081         resp3.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
1082         resp3.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=5");
1083 
1084         expect(mockBackend.execute(isA(HttpHost.class), capture(cap),
1085                 (HttpContext)isNull()))
1086             .andReturn(resp3);
1087 
1088         replayMocks();
1089         impl.execute(host, req1);
1090         impl.execute(host, req2);
1091         verifyMocks();
1092 
1093         HttpRequest captured = cap.getValue();
1094         boolean hasMaxAge0 = false;
1095         boolean hasNoCache = false;
1096         for(Header h : captured.getHeaders("Cache-Control")) {
1097             for(HeaderElement elt : h.getElements()) {
1098                 if ("max-age".equals(elt.getName())) {
1099                     try {
1100                         int maxage = Integer.parseInt(elt.getValue());
1101                         if (maxage == 0) {
1102                             hasMaxAge0 = true;
1103                         }
1104                     } catch (NumberFormatException nfe) {
1105                         // nop
1106                     }
1107                 } else if ("no-cache".equals(elt.getName())) {
1108                     hasNoCache = true;
1109                 }
1110             }
1111         }
1112         assertTrue(hasMaxAge0 || hasNoCache);
1113         assertNull(captured.getFirstHeader("If-None-Match"));
1114         assertNull(captured.getFirstHeader("If-Modified-Since"));
1115         assertNull(captured.getFirstHeader("If-Range"));
1116         assertNull(captured.getFirstHeader("If-Match"));
1117         assertNull(captured.getFirstHeader("If-Unmodified-Since"));
1118     }
1119 
1120     /* "If an entity tag was assigned to a cached representation, the
1121      * forwarded request SHOULD be conditional and include the entity
1122      * tags in an If-None-Match header field from all its cache entries
1123      * for the resource."
1124      *
1125      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.6
1126      */
1127     @Test
1128     public void testSendsAllVariantEtagsInConditionalRequest()
1129         throws Exception {
1130         HttpRequest req1 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET","/",HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1131         req1.setHeader("User-Agent","agent1");
1132         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1133         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=3600");
1134         resp1.setHeader("Vary","User-Agent");
1135         resp1.setHeader("Etag","\"etag1\"");
1136 
1137         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1138 
1139         HttpRequest req2 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET","/",HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1140         req2.setHeader("User-Agent","agent2");
1141         HttpResponse resp2 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1142         resp2.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=3600");
1143         resp2.setHeader("Vary","User-Agent");
1144         resp2.setHeader("Etag","\"etag2\"");
1145 
1146         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1147 
1148         Capture<HttpRequest> cap = new Capture<HttpRequest>();
1149         HttpRequest req3 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET","/",HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1150         req3.setHeader("User-Agent","agent3");
1151         HttpResponse resp3 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1152 
1153         EasyMock.expect(mockBackend.execute(EasyMock.eq(host),
1154                 EasyMock.capture(cap), (HttpContext)EasyMock.isNull()))
1155             .andReturn(resp3);
1156 
1157         replayMocks();
1158         impl.execute(host,req1);
1159         impl.execute(host,req2);
1160         impl.execute(host,req3);
1161         verifyMocks();
1162 
1163         HttpRequest captured = cap.getValue();
1164         boolean foundEtag1 = false;
1165         boolean foundEtag2 = false;
1166         for(Header h : captured.getHeaders("If-None-Match")) {
1167             for(String etag : h.getValue().split(",")) {
1168                 if ("\"etag1\"".equals(etag.trim())) {
1169                     foundEtag1 = true;
1170                 }
1171                 if ("\"etag2\"".equals(etag.trim())) {
1172                     foundEtag2 = true;
1173                 }
1174             }
1175         }
1176         assertTrue(foundEtag1 && foundEtag2);
1177     }
1178 
1179     /* "If the entity-tag of the new response matches that of an existing
1180      * entry, the new response SHOULD be used to update the header fields
1181      * of the existing entry, and the result MUST be returned to the
1182      * client."
1183      *
1184      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.6
1185      */
1186     @Test
1187     public void testResponseToExistingVariantsUpdatesEntry()
1188         throws Exception {
1189 
1190         Date now = new Date();
1191         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
1192 
1193         HttpRequest req1 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1194         req1.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent1");
1195 
1196         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1197         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
1198         resp1.setHeader("Vary", "User-Agent");
1199         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control", "max-age=3600");
1200         resp1.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag1\"");
1201 
1202 
1203         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1204 
1205         HttpRequest req2 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1206         req2.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent2");
1207 
1208         HttpResponse resp2 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1209         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
1210         resp2.setHeader("Vary", "User-Agent");
1211         resp2.setHeader("Cache-Control", "max-age=3600");
1212         resp2.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag2\"");
1213 
1214         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1215 
1216         HttpRequest req3 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1217         req3.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent3");
1218 
1219         HttpResponse resp3 = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED, "Not Modified");
1220         resp3.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
1221         resp3.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag1\"");
1222 
1223         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp3);
1224 
1225         HttpRequest req4 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1226         req4.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent1");
1227 
1228         replayMocks();
1229         impl.execute(host, req1);
1230         impl.execute(host, req2);
1231         HttpResponse result1 = impl.execute(host, req3);
1232         HttpResponse result2 = impl.execute(host, req4);
1233         verifyMocks();
1234 
1235         assertEquals(HttpStatus.SC_OK, result1.getStatusLine().getStatusCode());
1236         assertEquals("\"etag1\"", result1.getFirstHeader("ETag").getValue());
1237         assertEquals(formatDate(now), result1.getFirstHeader("Date").getValue());
1238         assertEquals(formatDate(now), result2.getFirstHeader("Date").getValue());
1239     }
1240 
1241     @Test
1242     public void testResponseToExistingVariantsIsCachedForFutureResponses()
1243         throws Exception {
1244 
1245         Date now = new Date();
1246         Date tenSecondsAgo = new Date(now.getTime() - 10 * 1000L);
1247 
1248         HttpRequest req1 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1249         req1.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent1");
1250 
1251         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1252         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
1253         resp1.setHeader("Vary", "User-Agent");
1254         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control", "max-age=3600");
1255         resp1.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag1\"");
1256 
1257         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1258 
1259         HttpRequest req2 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1260         req2.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent2");
1261 
1262         HttpResponse resp2 = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, HttpStatus.SC_NOT_MODIFIED, "Not Modified");
1263         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
1264         resp2.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag1\"");
1265 
1266         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1267 
1268         HttpRequest req3 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1269         req3.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent2");
1270 
1271         replayMocks();
1272         impl.execute(host, req1);
1273         impl.execute(host, req2);
1274         impl.execute(host, req3);
1275         verifyMocks();
1276     }

1278     /* "If any of the existing cache entries contains only partial content
1279      * for the associated entity, its entity-tag SHOULD NOT be included in
1280      * the If-None-Match header field unless the request is for a range
1281      * that would be fully satisfied by that entry."
1282      *
1283      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.6
1284      */
1285     @Test
1286     public void variantNegotiationsDoNotIncludeEtagsForPartialResponses()
1287             throws Exception {
1288         HttpRequest req1 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
1289         req1.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent1");
1290         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1291         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control", "max-age=3600");
1292         resp1.setHeader("Vary", "User-Agent");
1293         resp1.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag1\"");
1294 
1295         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1296 
1297         HttpRequest req2 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
1298         req2.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent2");
1299         req2.setHeader("Range", "bytes=0-49");
1300         HttpResponse resp2 = new BasicHttpResponse(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1,
1301                 HttpStatus.SC_PARTIAL_CONTENT, "Partial Content");
1302         resp2.setEntity(HttpTestUtils.makeBody(50));
1303         resp2.setHeader("Content-Length","50");
1304         resp2.setHeader("Content-Range","bytes 0-49/100");
1305         resp2.setHeader("Vary","User-Agent");
1306         resp2.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag2\"");
1307         resp2.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=3600");
1308         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(new Date()));
1309 
1310         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1311 
1312         HttpRequest req3 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
1313         req3.setHeader("User-Agent", "agent3");
1314 
1315         HttpResponse resp3 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1316         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control", "max-age=3600");
1317         resp1.setHeader("Vary", "User-Agent");
1318         resp1.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag3\"");
1319 
1320         Capture<HttpRequest> cap = new Capture<HttpRequest>();
1321         expect(mockBackend.execute(isA(HttpHost.class), capture(cap),
1322                 (HttpContext)isNull())).andReturn(resp3);
1323 
1324         replayMocks();
1325         impl.execute(host, req1);
1326         impl.execute(host, req2);
1327         impl.execute(host, req3);
1328         verifyMocks();
1329 
1330         HttpRequest captured = cap.getValue();
1331         for(Header h : captured.getHeaders("If-None-Match")) {
1332             for(HeaderElement elt : h.getElements()) {
1333                 assertFalse("\"etag2\"".equals(elt.toString()));
1334             }
1335         }
1336     }

1338     /* "If a cache receives a successful response whose Content-Location
1339      * field matches that of an existing cache entry for the same Request-
1340      * URI, whose entity-tag differs from that of the existing entry, and
1341      * whose Date is more recent than that of the existing entry, the
1342      * existing entry SHOULD NOT be returned in response to future requests
1343      * and SHOULD be deleted from the cache.
1344      *
1345      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.6
1346      */
1347     @Test
1348     public void cachedEntryShouldNotBeUsedIfMoreRecentMentionInContentLocation()
1349             throws Exception {
1350         HttpRequest req1 = new HttpGet("http://foo.example.com/");
1351         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1352         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=3600");
1353         resp1.setHeader("ETag", "\"old-etag\"");
1354         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));
1355 
1356         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1357 
1358         HttpRequest req2 = new HttpGet("http://foo.example.com/bar");
1359         HttpResponse resp2 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1360         resp2.setHeader("ETag", "\"new-etag\"");
1361         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
1362         resp2.setHeader("Content-Location", "http://foo.example.com/");
1363 
1364         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1365 
1366         HttpRequest req3 = new HttpGet("http://foo.example.com");
1367         HttpResponse resp3 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1368 
1369         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp3);
1370 
1371         replayMocks();
1372         impl.execute(host, req1);
1373         impl.execute(host, req2);
1374         impl.execute(host, req3);
1375         verifyMocks();
1376     }

1378     /*
1379      * "This specifically means that responses from HTTP/1.0 servers for such
1380      * URIs [those containing a '?' in the rel_path part] SHOULD NOT be taken
1381      * from a cache."
1382      *
1383      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.9
1384      */

1391         resp1.setHeader("Content-Length","200");
1392         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));

1394 
1395         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1396

1399         resp2.setEntity(HttpTestUtils.makeBody(200));
1400         resp2.setHeader("Content-Length","200");
1401         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
1402

1404

1439     /*
1440      * "A cache that passes through requests for methods it does not
1441      * understand SHOULD invalidate any entities referred to by the
1442      * Request-URI."
1443      *
1444      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.10
1445      */
1446     @Test
1447     public void shouldInvalidateNonvariantCacheEntryForUnknownMethod()
1448         throws Exception {

1451         resp1.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=3600");
1452

1454

1456         HttpResponse resp2 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1457         resp2.setHeader("Cache-Control","max-age=3600");
1458 
1459         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1460 
1461         HttpRequest req3 = new BasicHttpRequest("GET", "/", HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1);
1462         HttpResponse resp3 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1463         resp3.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag\"");
1464 
1465         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp3);
1466 
1467         replayMocks();

1469         impl.execute(host, req2);
1470         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req3);
1471         verifyMocks();
1472 
1473         assertTrue(HttpTestUtils.semanticallyTransparent(resp3, result));
1474     }

1528     /*
1529      * "If a new cacheable response is received from a resource while any
1530      * existing responses for the same resource are cached, the cache
1531      * SHOULD use the new response to reply to the current request."
1532      *
1533      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec13.html#sec13.12
1534      */
1535     @Test
1536     public void cacheShouldUpdateWithNewCacheableResponse()

1540         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(tenSecondsAgo));

1542         resp1.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag1\"");
1543 
1544         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1545 
1546         HttpRequest req2 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
1547         req2.setHeader("Cache-Control", "max-age=0");
1548         HttpResponse resp2 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1549         resp2.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
1550         resp2.setHeader("Cache-Control", "max-age=3600");
1551         resp2.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag2\"");
1552 
1553         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1554 
1555         HttpRequest req3 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
1556 
1557         replayMocks();

1559         impl.execute(host, req2);
1560         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req3);
1561         verifyMocks();
1562 
1563         assertTrue(HttpTestUtils.semanticallyTransparent(resp2, result));
1564     }

1566     /*
1567      * "Many HTTP/1.0 cache implementations will treat an Expires value
1568      * that is less than or equal to the response Date value as being
1569      * equivalent to the Cache-Control response directive 'no-cache'.
1570      * If an HTTP/1.1 cache receives such a response, and the response
1571      * does not include a Cache-Control header field, it SHOULD consider
1572      * the response to be non-cacheable in order to retain compatibility
1573      * with HTTP/1.0 servers."
1574      *
1575      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9.3
1576      */
1577     @Test
1578     public void expiresEqualToDateWithNoCacheControlIsNotCacheable()
1579         throws Exception {
1580         HttpRequest req1 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
1581         HttpResponse resp1 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1582         resp1.setHeader("Date", formatDate(now));
1583         resp1.setHeader("Expires", formatDate(now));
1584         resp1.removeHeaders("Cache-Control");
1585 
1586         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp1);
1587 
1588         HttpRequest req2 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
1589         req2.setHeader("Cache-Control", "max-stale=1000");
1590         HttpResponse resp2 = HttpTestUtils.make200Response();
1591         resp2.setHeader("ETag", "\"etag2\"");
1592 
1593         backendExpectsAnyRequest().andReturn(resp2);
1594 
1595         replayMocks();
1596         impl.execute(host, req1);
1597         HttpResponse result = impl.execute(host, req2);
1598         verifyMocks();
1599 
1600         assertTrue(HttpTestUtils.semanticallyTransparent(resp2, result));
1601     }

1629     /*
1630      * "If a request includes the no-cache directive, it SHOULD NOT
1631      * include min-fresh, max-stale, or max-age."
1632      *
1633      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9.4
1634      */
1635     @Test
1636     public void otherFreshnessRequestDirectivesNotAllowedWithNoCache()
1637         throws Exception {
1638         HttpRequest req1 = HttpTestUtils.makeDefaultRequest();
1639         req1.setHeader("Cache-Control", "min-fresh=10, no-cache");
1640         req1.addHeader("Cache-Control", "max-stale=0, max-age=0");
1641 
1642         Capture<HttpRequest> cap = new Capture<HttpRequest>();
1643         expect(mockBackend.execute(same(host), capture(cap), (HttpContext)isNull()))
1644             .andReturn(HttpTestUtils.make200Response());
1645 
1646         replayMocks();
1647         impl.execute(host, req1);
1648         verifyMocks();
1649 
1650         HttpRequest captured = cap.getValue();
1651         boolean foundNoCache = false;
1652         boolean foundDisallowedDirective = false;
1653         List<String> disallowed =
1654             Arrays.asList("min-fresh", "max-stale", "max-age");
1655         for(Header h : captured.getHeaders("Cache-Control")) {
1656             for(HeaderElement elt : h.getElements()) {
1657                 if (disallowed.contains(elt.getName())) {
1658                     foundDisallowedDirective = true;
1659                 }
1660                 if ("no-cache".equals(elt.getName())) {
1661                     foundNoCache = true;
1662                 }
1663             }
1664         }
1665         assertTrue(foundNoCache);
1666         assertFalse(foundDisallowedDirective);
1667     }

1669     /*
1670      * "To do this, the client may include the only-if-cached directive in
1671      * a request. If it receives this directive, a cache SHOULD either
1672      * respond using a cached entry that is consistent with the other
1673      * constraints of the request, or respond with a 504 (Gateway Timeout)
1674      * status."
1675      *
1676      * http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.9.4
1677      */
1678     @Test
1679     public void cacheMissResultsIn504WithOnlyIfCached()
1680         throws Exception {

1683 
1684         replayMocks();

1686         verifyMocks();
1687 
1688         assertEquals(HttpStatus.SC_GATEWAY_TIMEOUT,
1689                 result.getStatusLine().getStatusCode());
1690     }
